definitions.title: n.pr.loc.
definitions.body: Bethel (so read, not [[בֵּית־אֵל]] as Jos 7:2 + acc. to v. d. H; cf. Baer Ge 12:8; house of God, or house of Ēl)—

ancient place and seat of worship in Ephraim on border of Benjamin, identif. with Luz (former name) Ge 28:19, Ge 35:6, Jos 18:13, Ju Jdg 1:23; appar. distinguished from Luz Jos 16:2 (yet cf. Di); name connected with vision of Jacob when journeying to Paddan-Aram (JE) Ge 28:19, Ge 35:7 (where [[אֵל]] [[בֵּֽיתְאֵל]], but LXX SyrVer Vulgate Ol del. [[אֵל]]; Di maintains); cf. Ho 12:5; when journeying from P.-A. Ge 35:15 (P); name appar. given first to a stone (Ge 28:18, Ge 35:14) cf. We:Skizzen iii. 70; [[הַר בֵּֽיתְאֵל]] 1Sa 13:2; later important place of worship 1Sa 10:3 [[עָלָה אֶל־]] [[הָאֱלֽהִים בֵּיתְאֵל]]; abode of prophet 1Ki 13:11, 2Ki 2:3; Jeroboam set up one of the golden calves at Bethel 1Ki 12:29 f. cf. also 1Ki 13:1 f. 2Ki 10:29, 2Ki 23:15, Je 48:13 v. further 2Ki 17:28, 2Ki 23:15 Th prop. on internal grounds, [[בֵּית אַל]] house of nothingness, or [[אָלָה]] ´[[בּ]] house of execration; [[אָלָה]] ´[[בּ]] also Renan:Hist. iii. 185; in proph. Am 3:14, Am 4:4, Am 5:5, Am 5:5, Am 5:6, Am 7:10, Am 7:13, Ho 10:15; note esp. Am 5:5 [[ביתאל יִהְיֶה לְאָָוֶן]], & [[בֵּית אָרֶן]] (house of iniquity) as substit. for [[ביתאל]] Ho 4:15, Ho 5:8, Ho 10:5 ([[עֶגְלוֹת בית און]]);—mod. Beitîn Rob:BR i. 448 f. Guêrin:Judêe iii. 14–27 cf. Bd:Pal 215 Survey:ii. 305.
place in south country of Judah, not far from Beersheba & Ziklag 1Sa 30:27 cf. We Dr; = MT [[כסיל]] Jos 15:30 (txt. err.; LXX Baiqhl); also [[בְּתוּל]] Jos 19:4, [[בְּתוּאֵל]] 1Ch 4:30.
